prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. For the sketch, create a new face (face\\_1) and add two loops (loop\\_1 and loop\\_2) on this face. Loop\\_1 should contain a circle (circle\\_1) with center at 0.165, 0.165 and radius of 0.165. Loop\\_2 should also contain a circle (circle\\_1) with the same center but a smaller radius of 0.114. After creating the sketch, scale it using the scaling parameter 0.33. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model. Use an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.75 and no extrusion in the opposite direction. **Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a central hole and varying top and bottom shapes.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 180.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.33, 0.0. For the sketch, create two faces (face\\_1 and face\\_2). On face\\_1, add a loop (loop\\_1) containing a circle (circle\\_1) with center at 0.165, 0.165 and radius of 0.165. Add another loop (loop\\_2) on the same face with a circle (circle\\_1) of radius 0.114. On face\\_2, add a loop (loop\\_1) with a circle (circle\\_1) of radius 0.114 and another loop (loop\\_2) with a circle (circle\\_1) of radius 0.105. After creating the sketch, scale it using the scaling parameter 0.33. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. Extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model. Do not extrude in the positive normal direction and set the depth in the negative normal direction to 0.045.</description>
